s.text: We have previously shown that the in vitro priming protocol used in the present study induces the differentiation of early uncommitted CD4 +, CD27 +memory T cells into IL-4-producing effector cells [ 17].

In this regard, recent studies [ 31] have suggested that synovial tissue cells were selectively responsive to IL-12 produced in the synovium, because IL-12 induced increased production of IFN-?, but not IL-2 and IL-4.
Recent studies [ 32] have suggested that there is an intrinsic defect in the development of IL-4-producing effector cells in RA patients.
Aggressive forms of RA are thought to be driven by T-lymphocyte activity, leading to the rapid erosion of bone and cartilage.
Aggressive forms of RA are thought to be driven by T-lymphocyte activity, leading to the rapid erosion of bone and cartilage.
This was not different from the percentage found in RASF, but was significantly greater than the percentage of IFN-?-producing cells in normal blood ( P < 0.005) or RAPB ( P < 0.005).
